OpenMobileNetworkToolkit Android Testing Samsung IMS Sony Service Nokia enable SA Huawei Project Mediatek IMS iPerf3 Send Logging Service This app is provided by NGNI a department of Fraunhofer FOKUS.

Authors: 

Peter Hasse 
Mohsin Nisar 
Johann Hackler
OpenMobileNetworkToolkit about About OMNT OMNT OpenMobileNetworkToolkit, the swiss army knife for network researcher I need your permission Slicing OMNT_Notification Notification channel for OpenMobileNetworkToolkit
InfluxDB log InfluxDB instance URL / IP InfluxDB URL / IP (with protocol and port) InfluxDB Organization Set InfluxDB Organization Influx Token Set InfluxDB Token Log network information Log neighbour cells Log throughput information Log cell information Log IP addresses Log battery information InfluxDB bucket Set InfluxDB bucket Measurement name Tags Comma separated list of tags Enable InfluxDB log Start / stop the logging service Log to a local Influx 2.x database Log to a remote Influx 2.x database Work Profile Start on boot Start the logging service on device boot Use fake location Use a fake location for all measurements for testing / privacy reasons
Set up profile Enable forwarding of Share Intent Send a sample share Intent Disable forwarding This app is currently not the owner of this device or profile. Please tap Next to set up appropriate management by this app. The app is ready to control the managed profile. Remove managed profile Setup all done To manage the configuration in your managed profile, visit the badged version of this application. Set Chrome restrictions Clear Chrome restrictions Icon Sample Managed Profile No app can handle this intent. Set up managed profile Preferential Network Service Settings InfluxDB Special Codes Interval Log signal data Log to a local file Log file upload Subscriptions Ping Location is disabled, enable it or use fake location Enable Location Use fake location Location Disabled Radio Settings Set PLMN Select Access Network Type Persist until reboot Carrier Settings Apply carrier settings now Read Press the read button Exit

MQTT Username Enable MQTT Enable MQTT on boot Username provided by your MQTT-Broker MQTT Client Username Password provided by your MQTT-Broker MQTT Client Password MQTT-Broker Address, including Port MQTT-Broker Address 192.168.213.89:1883 MQTT Service
Do you want to clear all Configuartions? Yes No
N/A
BSIC WCMDA dBm WCMDA EcNo Type Alpha Long Bands CI MNC PCI TAC Level Is Registered Cell Connection Status ASU Level LAC Timing Advance Bit Error Rate BER dBm RSSI EARFCN Bandwidth CQI RSRP RSRQ RSSNR MCC NRARFCN CSI RSRP CSI RSRQ CSI SINR SS RSRP SS RSRQ SS SINR PLMN No Cell Information Available
Model Manufacturer SoC Manufacturer SoC Model Radio Version Supported Modem Count Android SDK Android Release Device Software Version Security Patch Level IMEI IMSI MEID SIM Serial Network Access Identifier Subscription ID
Longitude Latitude Altitude Provider Accuracy Speed
Network Operator Name SIM Operator Name Network Specifier Data State Data Network Type Phone Type Preferred Opportunistic Data Subscription ID
SSID BSSID
Frequency Link Speed TX Link Speed Max Supported TX Speed RX Link Speed Max Supported RX Speed Standard Channel Bandwidth Security Type Serving Cell Parameter: PCI, RSRP... Enable Cell Notification Serving Cell ICMP / Ping Special Codes Subscriptions
 About Notification settings Unique Device Name Rerun X Parameter if enabled, ping will repeat, until disabled Level AsuLevel
 "Signal Strength Level: " Excellent Good Fair Poor Ch Bw Freq Sec Type Slicing is a 5G SA only feature. It requires configuration on your core network. This is still under developemnt Enterprise 1 Enterprise 2 Enterprise 3 filter string This will log NetworkInformation to InfluxDB. Like NetworkOperatorName, SimOperatorName, DataNetworkType. This will log SignalStrength to InfluxDB. Like RSRP, RSRQ from the SignalStrength API. This will log CellInformation to InfluxDB. Like CellId, MCC, MNC, PCI, but also RSRP, RSRQ from the CellInformation API. This will log neighbour CellInformation data to InfluxDB. Like CellId, MCC, MNC, PCI, but also RSRP, RSRQ from the CellInformation API. This will log InterfaceThroughput data to InfluxDB. Like download and upload throughput, what the phone thinks what is currently possible. This will log WifiInformation data to InfluxDB. Like SSID, BSSID, RSSI, Frequency, LinkSpeed, and WifiStandard. This will log BatteryInformation data to InfluxDB. Like BatteryLevel and Charging Status. This will log IPAddressInformation data to InfluxDB. Like IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, and the interface name. Click here for Android Doc This configures a remote InfluxDB instance to log data to. This configures a local InfluxDB instance, running on the Device, to log data to. EXPERIMENTAL This configures the logging Service of OMNT. Influx URL, it can either be http://IP:8086, https://IP:8086, or any hostname. Influx ORG Name, or ID. Influx TOKEN Influx Bucket Name or ID. Enables MQTT Services for OMNT. Section to set Credentials for MQTT. MQTT Broker Address MQTT Client Password. Opens Link to Android Doc. Select Network Type Shows neighbour cells only when connected to a network and is announced by the network. Set unique device name. Configure the Logging Parameter. Configure Mobile Network Settings, only if the App has Carrier Permissions. Reboots the modem, only possible when OMNT has Carrier Permissions. Configure MQTT for OMNT. Import/Export Config of OMNT.
